Description: RARE! Vintage Soviet SLAVA 27 JEWELS AutomaticWatch in good working condition, Second Moscow Watch Factory (abbreviated name - OJSC "Glory") - counts its history back to 1924 in the merger of Moscow radio telegraph plant and electromechanical and watchmaking. Already by 1930, the plant began to produce clocks, street elektrochasov and alarms. During World War II the factory was evacuated to Chistopol city and carried out assignments for the war effort. After the Second World War on the basis of the Second Watch Factory was established Chistopol Watch Factory "Vostok", famous brand watches "Commander." In the postwar years of "VCHZ-Glory" began to produce pocket watches "Salute" and women's watches "Era", table clocks and issued his famous model - the "Victory". The market watches "Glory" will appear in the second half of the 50s, when it was mastered the production of small-sized alarm clocks and watches, electronic and mechanical watches. Since that time the clock "SLAVA" is the main area of ​​specialization and production. High production and technical capacity has allowed the company to create the first in the USSR quartz watches. In recent years, after the reorganization, and the choice of marketing strategy of the enterprise, "Second Watch Factory" Slava "" moved to a whole new level.Products: Mechanical watches SLAVA;Multifunction Clock SLAVA;Quartz watches SLAVA;Gold watch SLAVA.Manufacturing (shop): • The assembly shop;• pressing and blanking shop;• Mechanical workshop;• Electroplating;• Transport department.ShippingEurope: 7-14 business days Canada: 10-20 business days USA: 10-20 business days Australia and everywhere else: 15-30 business days
Title: SLAVA AUTOMATIC 27JEWELS VERY VERY RARE USSR SOVIET WRISTWATCH
